Multiboot grub4dos disc. You can boot iso files from usb or cd/dvd. On some machines I am getting asked for serial. Probably just due to my inexperience with grub4dos. If I extract to root of usb , I have no problems. If you have not heard of grub4dos head over to http://www.boot-land.net/forums/ and check out the forums. Thanks again.

Dingo57,

Did you find a solution to the password/username request in grub4DOS? Strange how it only applies to certain computers.

sn:0JQE20-64YJV5-NHJHN3-5P8H51-32R4MZ
use any user name
That code worked for me  so though I would throw it out for you all! Thanks for the up :D

Hi, Solution to key issue is to copy the BOOTDISK.KEY file to root of DVD or USB. The reason  I had different results with different PCs, is cause once you enter serial it saves as file on local machine, and no need to enter serial if booting from that PC again. Thanks Thethingy.
PS. Check out SARDU for an awesome boot rescue disk. http://www.sarducd.it/

you dont need to use Grub to boot from a usb drive just get hirens usb format tool just format and copy all files from the iso to the drive the issue with the key file is just the fact that the software automaticly looks for the key in the cd/dvd bay if you let the run all the way throw extra keyboard screen dont hit ok you wont have any issue with any usb booting   or just get the version 4.1.4 and use the usb format option in the real software (ive used this on everything from PNY to centon usbs to seagate freaagent and WD harddrives)
